children.html: Ayn Rand (1905 - 1982) is a Russian-American novelist and philosopher. She acquired mainstream recognition, and a cult status among libertarians, especially in the business and politics circles. She is the author of Atlas Shrugged, a fiction work of more than 1000 pages which has long been one of the most sold books in the USA.

Ayn Rand developed a philosophy she called "Objectivism", and which praises an ethics of rational self-interest. 
        In "The Virtue of Selfishness", she writes that "man must live for his own sake [...] [meaning] that the achievement 
        of his own happiness is man’s highest moral purpose" [@rand1961objectivist]. 
        Politically, she believed in "pure, uncontrolled, unregulated laissez-faire 
        capitalism" [@rand1961objectivist], which according to her was the only political system that could enable humans 
        to realize their full creative potential. "The material [to actualize man's potential] is the whole of the universe, 
        with no limits set to the knowledge he can acquire and to the enjoyment of life he can achieve" [@rand1961objectivist].

title: Ayn Rand on Selfishness, Happiness and Freedom
